00189 template <class AdaptableUnaryFunction, class Iterator, class Reference = use_default, class Value = use_default>
00190   class transform_iterator
00191     : public detail::transform_iterator_base<AdaptableUnaryFunction, Iterator, Reference, Value>::type
00192 {
00195   public:
00196     typedef typename
00197     detail::transform_iterator_base<AdaptableUnaryFunction, Iterator, Reference, Value>::type
00198     super_t;
00199 
00200     friend class experimental::iterator_core_access;
00204   public:
00207     __host__ __device__
00208     transform_iterator() {}
00209   
00216     __host__ __device__
00217     transform_iterator(Iterator const& x, AdaptableUnaryFunction f)
00218       : super_t(x), m_f(f) {
00219     }
00220   
00226     __host__ __device__
00227     explicit transform_iterator(Iterator const& x)
00228       : super_t(x) { }
00229 
00235     template<typename OtherAdaptableUnaryFunction,
00236              typename OtherIterator,
00237              typename OtherReference,
00238              typename OtherValue>
00239     __host__ __device__
00240     transform_iterator(const transform_iterator<OtherAdaptableUnaryFunction, OtherIterator, OtherReference, OtherValue> &other,
00241                        typename thrust::detail::enable_if_convertible<OtherIterator, Iterator>::type* = 0,
00242                        typename thrust::detail::enable_if_convertible<OtherAdaptableUnaryFunction, AdaptableUnaryFunction>::type* = 0)
00243       : super_t(other.base()), m_f(other.functor()) {}
00244 
00255     __host__ __device__
00256     transform_iterator &operator=(const transform_iterator &other)
00257     {
00258       return do_assign(other,
00259       // XXX gcc 4.2.1 crashes on is_copy_assignable; just assume the functor is assignable as a WAR
00260 #if (THRUST_HOST_COMPILER == THRUST_HOST_COMPILER_GCC) && (THRUST_GCC_VERSION <= 40201)
00261           thrust::detail::true_type()
00262 #else
00263           typename thrust::detail::is_copy_assignable<AdaptableUnaryFunction>::type()
00264 #endif // THRUST_HOST_COMPILER
00265       );
00266     }
00267 
00271     __host__ __device__
00272     AdaptableUnaryFunction functor() const
00273       { return m_f; }
00274 
00277   private:
00278     __host__ __device__
00279     transform_iterator &do_assign(const transform_iterator &other, thrust::detail::true_type)
00280     {
00281       super_t::operator=(other);
00282 
00283       // do assign to m_f
00284       m_f = other.functor();
00285 
00286       return *this;
00287     }
00288 
00289     __host__ __device__
00290     transform_iterator &do_assign(const transform_iterator &other, thrust::detail::false_type)
00291     {
00292       super_t::operator=(other);
00293 
00294       // don't assign to m_f
00295 
00296       return *this;
00297     }
00298 
00299     __host__ __device__
00300     typename super_t::reference dereference() const
00301     { 
00302       // XXX consider making this a member instead of a temporary created inside dereference
00303       thrust::detail::host_device_function<AdaptableUnaryFunction, typename super_t::reference> wrapped_f(m_f);
00304 
00305       return wrapped_f(*this->base());
00306     }
00307 
00308     // tag this as mutable per Dave Abrahams in this thread:
00309     // http://lists.boost.org/Archives/boost/2004/05/65332.php
00310     mutable AdaptableUnaryFunction m_f;
00311 
00314 }; // end transform_iterator

00328 template <class AdaptableUnaryFunction, class Iterator>
00329 inline __host__ __device__
00330 transform_iterator<AdaptableUnaryFunction, Iterator>
00331 make_transform_iterator(Iterator it, AdaptableUnaryFunction fun)
00332 {
00333   return transform_iterator<AdaptableUnaryFunction, Iterator>(it, fun);
00334 } // end make_transform_iterator
